8950/A0/03/001/002.status_value: Adding of a number of forms of violence in the SWIS system is underway and will be completed in Q1 of 2017.
8950/A0/03/001/002.indicator_name: "Data on some forms of violence  exploitation and abuse of children are collected through routine administrative sources "
8950/A0/03/001/002.headline: Government`s commitment to prevent violence against children translated into amendments of the Family Law  introducing a ban on corporal punishment  launching of multi-year campaign on protection of children from violence and development of the first national Strategy on Protection of Children from Violence (2017-2021).
8950/A0/03/001/002.baseline_value: Data collection on some forms of violence exist (SWIS) but needs to be emproved
8950/A0/03/001/002.target_value: Existing data collection system emproved by number of forms of violence added in the system SWIS

8950/A0/03/002/002.status_value: 22 indicators agreed  adopted and included into existing judiciary data base. Professionals from judiciary trained on how to incorporate data and prepare statistical reports. However  data filling and usage of data base is sporadic and not fully effective
8950/A0/03/002/002.indicator_name: Judicial Council develops and adopts new indicators on children in conflict/contact with the law and integrates them into Judicial Informational System
8950/A0/03/002/002.headline: The CO actively promoted evidence-based policy making and continued with strategic engagement in capacity development of key partners and evidence generation pertaining to children  which also informed programme interventions in education  social and child protection  and emerging work with adolescents and C4SC campaigns Preschool for all and End violence online.

8950/A0/03/002/002.indicator_name: Percentage of cases that Centre`s for Social Welfare and the Ministry of Labor and Social Welfare record and regularly update in the child protection database
8950/A0/03/002/002.headline: The CO actively promoted evidence-based policy making and continued with strategic engagement in capacity development of key partners and evidence generation pertaining to children  which also informed programme interventions in education  social and child protection  and emerging work with adolescents and C4SC campaigns Preschool for all and End violence online.

8950/A0/03/002/002.indicator_name: Joint Inclusion Memorandum signed and identifies key policy issues tackling poverty and social exclusion of children
8950/A0/03/002/002.headline: The CO actively promoted evidence-based policy making and continued with strategic engagement in capacity development of key partners and evidence generation pertaining to children  which also informed programme interventions in education  social and child protection  and emerging work with adolescents and C4SC campaigns Preschool for all and End violence online.

8950/A0/03/002/002.status_value: Data base has been installed and is operational as of January 2013.
8950/A0/03/002/002.indicator_name: Centre`s for Social Welfare and the Ministry of Labor and Social Welfare make use of electronic database for managing and processing child protection data
8950/A0/03/002/002.headline: The CO actively promoted evidence-based policy making and continued with strategic engagement in capacity development of key partners and evidence generation pertaining to children  which also informed programme interventions in education  social and child protection  and emerging work with adolescents and C4SC campaigns Preschool for all and End violence online.

8950/A0/03/002/002.status_value: 10 non- kinship foster families placing 14 children  220 kinship foster families placing 307 children in 2013
8950/A0/03/002/002.headline: The CO actively promoted evidence-based policy making and continued with strategic engagement in capacity development of key partners and evidence generation pertaining to children  which also informed programme interventions in education  social and child protection  and emerging work with adolescents and C4SC campaigns Preschool for all and End violence online.

8950/A0/03/002/001.status_value: More than 80% of bylaws are adopted
8950/A0/03/002/001.indicator_name: By 2015 regulatory framework (bylaws  guidelines  etc) to the Law on Social and Child Protection adopted and in line with international standards
8950/A0/03/002/001.headline: Family Law of Montenegro harmonised with respective international instruments and standards and first ever National Strategy on Protection of Children from Violence were developed in 2016 contributing to a strengthened inter-sectoral cooperation in the area of fight against violence.

8950/A0/03/002/001.indicator_name: Family Law amended and aligned with respective international instruments
8950/A0/03/002/001.headline: Family Law of Montenegro harmonised with respective international instruments and standards and first ever National Strategy on Protection of Children from Violence were developed in 2016 contributing to a strengthened inter-sectoral cooperation in the area of fight against violence.

8950/A0/03/002/001.status_value: Government adopted the new Strategy on preschool education  fully aligned with UNICEF's recommendations
8950/A0/03/002/001.indicator_name: By 2015 strategic plan for expansion of coverage of children 4-6 years of age with quality ECE services developed and adopted by the Government
8950/A0/03/002/001.headline: Family Law of Montenegro harmonised with respective international instruments and standards and first ever National Strategy on Protection of Children from Violence were developed in 2016 contributing to a strengthened inter-sectoral cooperation in the area of fight against violence.

8950/A0/03/002/001.status_value: Policy paper for improvement of quality of education prepared. National body for improving quality of education established but not fully operational.
8950/A0/03/002/001.indicator_name: By 2015 policy for improvement of quality of education developed and implementation and monitoring and evaluation mechanisms in place
8950/A0/03/002/001.headline: Family Law of Montenegro harmonised with respective international instruments and standards and first ever National Strategy on Protection of Children from Violence were developed in 2016 contributing to a strengthened inter-sectoral cooperation in the area of fight against violence.

8950/A0/03/002/001.status_value: The Law on Social and Child Care system reform is adopted with UNICEF support. Bylaws are in preparation
8950/A0/03/002/001.indicator_name: Law on Social and Child Welfare adopted and in line with international standards
8950/A0/03/002/001.headline: Family Law of Montenegro harmonised with respective international instruments and standards and first ever National Strategy on Protection of Children from Violence were developed in 2016 contributing to a strengthened inter-sectoral cooperation in the area of fight against violence.

8950/A0/03/002/001.status_value: The Law on proceedings with juveniles in criminal procedures is adopted and aligned with international standards. Trainings are being continuously provided by UNICEF and separate training curricula developed for judges  prosecutors  police  lawyers. Rulebook on House Rules for Execution of Juvenile Imprisonment Sentence and the Rulebook on Implementation of Institutional Measure of Referral to a Correctional Institution are developed with UNICEF technical expertise and adopted.
8950/A0/03/002/001.indicator_name: Law on proceeding with juveniles in criminal procedures adopted and in line with international standards
8950/A0/03/002/001.headline: Family Law of Montenegro harmonised with respective international instruments and standards and first ever National Strategy on Protection of Children from Violence were developed in 2016 contributing to a strengthened inter-sectoral cooperation in the area of fight against violence.

8950/A0/03/002/001.status_value: Amendments to the Family Law adopted by the Parliament
8950/A0/03/002/001.indicator_name: Existence of legislation  that recognize children's right to be heard in civil and administrative proceedings that affect them (in line with Article 12 of the CRC)
8950/A0/03/002/001.headline: Family Law of Montenegro harmonised with respective international instruments and standards and first ever National Strategy on Protection of Children from Violence were developed in 2016 contributing to a strengthened inter-sectoral cooperation in the area of fight against violence.
8950/A0/03/002/001.baseline_value: Draft amendments to the Family Law  recognising children's rights to be heard in civil and administrative proceeding submitted for Parliament's adoption
8950/A0/03/002/001.target_value: Amendments to the Law adopted by the Parliament

8950/A0/04/003/001.indicator_name: Permanent national human rights coordinating mechanism is in place
8950/A0/04/003/001.headline: Major duty bearers  including independent National Human Rights Institutions (NHRI) and CSOs are in the continuous process of strengthening its capacity and accountability mechanisms for improved monitoring and reporting on child rights. Major progress is expected following the release of CRM evaluation`s findings and its consequent practical implementation.

8950/A0/04/003/001.status_value: Capacity building activity agreed with NHRI.
8950/A0/04/003/001.indicator_name: Percentage of Ombudspersons` professionals working with children qualified to monitor the implementation of child rights related legal framework and practices and procedural safeguards for children
8950/A0/04/003/001.headline: Major duty bearers  including independent National Human Rights Institutions (NHRI) and CSOs are in the continuous process of strengthening its capacity and accountability mechanisms for improved monitoring and reporting on child rights. Major progress is expected following the release of CRM evaluation`s findings and its consequent practical implementation.

8950/A0/04/003/001.status_value: The network of civil society organizations that are able to monitor violence against girls and boys and inclusion of children with disabilities established.
8950/A0/04/003/001.indicator_name: Existence of a network of civil society organizations that are able to monitor violence against boys and girls and social inclusion of children with disabilities
8950/A0/04/003/001.headline: Major duty bearers  including independent National Human Rights Institutions (NHRI) and CSOs are in the continuous process of strengthening its capacity and accountability mechanisms for improved monitoring and reporting on child rights. Major progress is expected following the release of CRM evaluation`s findings and its consequent practical implementation.

8950/A0/04/003/001.status_value: CRM Evaluation ongoing. Recommendations to be issued at the end of December 2017.
8950/A0/04/003/001.indicator_name: No. of programme concept notes developed based on the recommendations of CRM evaluation
8950/A0/04/003/001.headline: Major duty bearers  including independent National Human Rights Institutions (NHRI) and CSOs are in the continuous process of strengthening its capacity and accountability mechanisms for improved monitoring and reporting on child rights. Major progress is expected following the release of CRM evaluation`s findings and its consequent practical implementation.

8950/A0/04/003/002.indicator_name: Number of child-rights-based indicators incorporated in Social Welfare Information System (SWIS)
8950/A0/04/003/002.headline: The upgrade of MEIS is agreed with the Ministry of Education in order to prevent dropout and provide feedback to schools. Child-rights-based indicators in social protection and judiciary are not yet fully integrated and available. MICS-related activities are pending since the co-financing by the Government is not yet confirmed.

8950/A0/04/003/002.indicator_name: No. of MICS survey questionnaires for general and Roma population completed
8950/A0/04/003/002.headline: The upgrade of MEIS is agreed with the Ministry of Education in order to prevent dropout and provide feedback to schools. Child-rights-based indicators in social protection and judiciary are not yet fully integrated and available. MICS-related activities are pending since the co-financing by the Government is not yet confirmed.

8950/A0/03/003/002.indicator_name: Number of child related complaints submitted  to Ombudsperson's office
8950/A0/03/003/002.headline: UNICEF has been intensively working on strengthening of the capacities of Ombudsperson`s Office towards enhanced child rights monitoring and wide promotion of its function and mandate among children and families.

8950/A0/03/003/002.status_value: Accessibility of Ombudsman's institution has been increased number of applications in regard children are steadily increasing: 50 applications in 2010 and 60 applications in 2012. Child rights Council does not yet provide strategic leadership and policy planning in regard children.
8950/A0/03/003/002.indicator_name: Number of strategic child focused reports produced by Ombudsperson office presented to public  communicated with decision-makers and have impact on improvements in policy and/or practice
8950/A0/03/003/002.headline: UNICEF has been intensively working on strengthening of the capacities of Ombudsperson`s Office towards enhanced child rights monitoring and wide promotion of its function and mandate among children and families.

8950/A0/03/003/002.status_value: Network of child rights civil society groups that are able to monitor and report on child rights violations established
8950/A0/03/003/002.indicator_name: "(DEACTIVATED Jan 1 2017) Existence of Ombudsmans Office  National Human Rights Instititution  or a network of child rights civil society groups that are able to monitor and report on child rights violations "
8950/A0/03/003/002.headline: UNICEF has been intensively working on strengthening of the capacities of Ombudsperson`s Office towards enhanced child rights monitoring and wide promotion of its function and mandate among children and families.
8950/A0/03/003/002.baseline_value: Ombudsmans Office exists  but Network of child rights civil society groups that are able to monitor and report on child rights violations does not exist
8950/A0/03/003/002.target_value: Network of child rights civil society groups that are able to monitor and report on child rights violations established

8950/A0/04/003/003.status_value: International legal expert produced initial input for child friendly website to be posted at MoJ`s webpage (legal context and adaptation on child friendly language). To be shared with MoJ for comments and adjusted to the needs of children belonging to minorities and children with disabilities.
8950/A0/04/003/003.indicator_name: Availability of child friendly website and promotional materials  including in the language/form understandable to children belonging to minority groups and children with disabilities
8950/A0/04/003/003.headline: Initial steps have been taken to enhance awareness and understanding of children as rights holders through the development of relevant material (legal content adjusted in child friendly language) to be further adjusted to children belonging to minority groups and children with disabilities and integrated in Ministry of Justice`s Website.
8950/A0/04/003/003.baseline_value: Child friendly website not set up
